reviewText: FOR SOME REASON I THOUGHT I WAS ORDERING A BOOK, BUT AFTER WATCHING THE FILM, I FOUND IT QUITE INTRIGUING AND A WELL DONE PRESENTATION. IT ANSWERED ALL OF MY QUESTIONS AND PEAKED MY INTEREST.

Hi,

An interesting tale from one of the merchants of death.

This is a 54 minute documentary about Harlem heroin dealer Freddie Myers as told by Freddie himself. The film is told chronologically and in many ways glorifies drug trafficking and makes snitching look bad. As a documentary it was interesting, but it seems to give the wrong message.

For those who like this film may try free U-tube video : Superfly Untold story of Frank Lucas . You should also be able to find most if not all of the film available free on line. U-tube has clips and links.

Parental Guide: F-bomb. No sex or nudity.

This one is for all the "street doc" fans Freddie Myers is a real "O.G." from the late 60's early 70's this documentary will take you from his start as a jewel theif to the top of Harlem's heroin trade he followed the code of the streets and was and is a true gentlman.
Freddie personally tells his story after 24 years (!) of incarceration he did his time and never snitched on anyone.  He also shares stories about Frank Matthews and so called "kingpin" Frank Lucas.  I highly recommend this movie for fans of stories about "true" gangstas! Purchase today!
